intro: Turnera blanchetiana var. blanchetiana, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of branches. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
